mdRecord.dcterms:title: Indians; After John White's drawings: [Indians] [verso]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Frankfort; Note: image depicts verso; see "Related Item" field for front of image. These depictions of ten native peoples from Virginia and Roanoke are based on the drawings of John White, who documented the English expedition under the direction of Sir Walter Raleigh. They appear in Theodor de Bry's Grands Voyages, Part I, German edition, page 168, in the chapter describing Virginia. --From This New Founde Lande: The Henry & Kaye Spalding Map Collection at Hampden-Sydney College, 2008.
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Bry, Theodor de, 1528-1598
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Indians of North America
Human figure in art
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: Henry and Kaye Spalding Map Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:provenance: The Henry and Kaye Spalding Map Collection at Hampden-Sydney College; Image appears on pg. 18 (plate 28a) of This New Founde Land, Hampden-Sydney College, Virginia, 2008
